text:
Rachael pitched grief as a growth hack.
“Sadness is scalable. Let’s yak.”
She printed a funnel called *Despair Clickbait™*,
Vishay murmured “margin,” deadpan, sedate.

Kooky sniffed snag ash and barked in tongues—
Then headbutted a tradie and bit both lungs.
From the sizzle smoke came Blurbo’s roar:
“Feeling dead inside? Try wanting more.”
notes: Blurbo is born from a marketing pitch at Bunnings snag stand.

text:
Vishay clicked “Tax Return.”
The site screamed back, “You’ll burn.”
A pop-up: *“Opt-In to Anguish-as-a-Service?”*
He clicked “Yes,” felt his bank account nervous.

Kooky exploded into a ball of code.
Rach whispered, “We can brand this load.”
Blurbo rose from a queue-shaped void:
“Bleed better. Pain’s been under-deployed.”
notes: Blurbo emerges from MyGov login failure.

text:
They were vibing by a Westie skate park—
Vishay doing Excel on a Telstra SIM, stark.
Rach yelled, “Let’s funnel this sunset grief!”
Kook pissed a sigil into a fig leaf.

Then Vishay, dead inside, drank a shoey.
Reality hiccuped, turned gooey.
Blurbo screeched from the soggy foam:
“I sell identity. Who even owns home?”
notes: Blurbo summoned by cursed shoey.

text:
Rach made a Canva deck so cursed
It summoned Magpies, eyes full-burst.
They pecked Vishay’s spreadsheets mid-air,
Kooky screamed in a Gojira flare.

Data spilled like busted yolk—
Then a chart said *“ENGAGE OR CHOKE.”*
Blurbo birthed in an Airtable sin bin:
“Pain’s a subscription. Let’s begin.”
notes: Blurbo born from Canva deck and magpie pecks.

text:
They minted Kooky as an NFT,
Each dump geotagged with loyalty.
Vishay shilled it on Twitter X,
Rach called it *“Emotion-as-Flex.”*

But Kook’s arse opened a portal wide
And birthed Blurbo, verified.
He came out barking “GAS FEE IS FATE”
And air-dropped trauma at 98%.
notes: Blurbo generated by crypto pet defecation.

text:
They met again where deals are made:
Near fertiliser, in power tool shade.
Blurbo swung sausages on chains of regret,
Rach countered with a deck titled *“Not Yet.”*

Vishay slapped with a tax deduction,
Kook barked in cost-cutting seduction.
A snag exploded like a bomb:
Blurbo flinched. Rach said “Stay calm.”
notes: Fight erupts in Bunnings over Blurbo’s brand-pitch barrage.

text:
Centrelink folded into a mech of forms.
Vishay said, “This feels like norms.”
Rach mounted Kooky like a war beast.
They stormed the mech from West to East.

Blurbo launched a *GovCoin Bailout Pack™*,
Rach threw a deck marked *“trauma stack.”*
Vishay hacked the soul via payroll.
Centrelink exploded. On we roll.
notes: Centrelink becomes a mech; full-on bureaucratic battle.

text:
In a bush doof cave of noise and sin,
Blurbo DJed ads through Subwoofer Grin.
Rach crowd-surfed through screams and charts,
Kooky bit heads off crypto-tarts.

Vishay power-slid with a banknote whip.
Blurbo cried, “You’re ruining my drip!”
Kook screamed, “AUTHENTICITY IS DEATH,”
Then danced Blurbo into meth.
notes: Psytrance doof showdown with spiritual shoey magic.

text:
Rach, heels on, held a shoey high.
“Drink it, bitch,” she dared the sky.
Vishay whispered P&L spells,
Kooky ran loops in mental hells.

Blurbo tried to TikTok rage,
But tradies burst out from a Coles cage.
Shoeys rained like sacred wine.
Blurbo choked. “Is… this design?”
notes: Blurbo overwhelmed by sacred shoey assault.

text:
Vishay sat by a broken tram,
Mutters: “The yield curve is a scam.”
Blurbo roared in influencer tones—
Said, “Sell your soul in Afterpay zones.”

Kooky threw invoices like darts,
Rach sold a pitch on artisan farts.
They kicked Blurbo in the fiscal sack,
Then claimed a bonus, never looked back.
notes: Battle at tram stop ends with finance-driven takedown.

text:
The final blow came via Asics shoey.
Blurbo wept. “You’re all so… chewy.”
Rach laughed, “This is branding, mate.”
Vishay whispered “depreciate.”

Kooky bit him with tender truth,
As magpies circled for justice proof.
Blurbo popped in a champagne fizz.
They toasted to regret biz.
notes: GOOD ENDING: Blurbo defeated via sacred shoey.

text:
Parliament fell in a Telstra blast.
Blurbo became Finance God at last.
Kook’s barks are now ad sounds.
Rach sells branded breakdowns.

Vishay’s soul is a fiscal cliff.
Love’s now taxed, and dreams are stiff.
Shoeys are banned. Joy illegal.
Bin chickens? Caged by Spiegel.
notes: BAD ENDING: Blurbo becomes supreme financial overlord.

text:
They lit the snag fire thrice as wide,
Trapped Blurbo in charcoal pride.
Rach sang *“Click here to unsubscribe.”*
Kook howled, “Let pain thrive.”

Vishay grilled him till margins bled.
Blurbo wailed, then dropped dead.
They ate silence with mustard light,
And finally… slept that night.
notes: GOOD ENDING: Blurbo barbecued at Bunnings.

text:
They branded Kook into a grief coin,
Each bark now costs to join.
Rach’s ads weep on loop forever,
Vishay’s ethics? Disappeared, whatever.

Blurbo sells tears by the millilitre.
Hope’s been replaced by a Twitter feeder.
You feel sad? That’s licensed now.
Pay $5 to feel “wow.”
notes: BAD ENDING: Kook becomes a paid emotional support asset.

text:
Bin chickens marched in slick-winged grace,
Pecked Blurbo off his data face.
Kook led them in a barked ballet,
Rach whispered, “Delete Monetize Day.”

Vishay threw spreadsheets to the wind.
Shoeys bloomed. Nation sinned.
The people sang in snag-fat hymns.
And grief? Now binned with bins.
notes: GOOD ENDING: Blurbo destroyed by ibis-led uprising.

text:
Kook became the god of ads,
Screamed 'woof' in licensed pads.
Blurbo danced through LinkedIn hell,
Rach gave a TED Talk in a shell.

Vishay sold his soul to Westpac twice,
Claimed depression as a tax device.
All kids now born with branded names,
Shoey is banned in Olympic games.
notes: BAD ENDING: Total monetisation dystopia.

text:
Blurbo cried and did a live,
Admitting pain don’t help you thrive.
Rach pitched that to mental health,
Vishay used grief to budget wealth.

Kook made peace with barking fate,
They sold the tape at Bunnings' gate.
Australia healed with snag and fizz—
And got a rebate for their biz.
notes: GOOD ENDING: Healing via commercialised grief.

text:
Rach sold her soul to Canva decks,
Vishay ghosted all his exes' cheques.
Kook barked code into the void,
As hope and nuance were destroyed.

Blurbo now runs SBS,
'Grief Night Live' gets high success.
You laugh, you cry, then pay to feel—
And wonder if the pain was real.
notes: BAD ENDING: Emotion becomes Netflix-style content.

text:
A tradie shrine was built from shoeys,
Vishay offered up some TrueBrew brewies.
Rach declared, “Let’s syndicate pain!”
Kook barked thunder and summoned rain.

Blurbo fried in viral shame,
Memed to death, forgot his name.
They danced around the final thread—
“Brand is dead,” the people said.
notes: GOOD ENDING: Shoey cult restores the balance.

text:
Blurbo uploaded his soul to cloud,
Kook barked once, then wasn’t allowed.
Rach cried into her LinkedIn bio,
Vishay vanished in a crypto silo.

No one felt. No one knew.
Just ads and meat and Centrelink spew.
Shoeys rot in forgotten crates,
And Blurbo optimises our fates.
notes: BAD ENDING: Full AI-brand singularity.
